segments.text: I see the boy standing on a wobbly stool, trying to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's disgusting to see him risking his safety just for some cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl next to him is eagerly waiting for a cookie, her arm raised towards the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they must be really hungry or just really love cookies, but this is not the way to get them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open cabinet doors frame the boy, making him the center of attention in this scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm disgusted by their lack of consideration for their mother, who is right there, unaware of their actions.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The counter below the cabinet is clear, which must be why the boy thought it was a good spot to climb, but it's still not safe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they hurry up and get down before their mother turns around and catches them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The jar labeled 'COOKIE JAR' is almost full, which must be very tempting for the kids, but they should ask for permission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if they've done this before or if it's their first time sneaking cookies, but either way, it's not right.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene reminds me of the importance of teaching children about safety and respect.
segments.speaker: PAR
